alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:07PM EST until January 28 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Rhode Island... Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Providence and Kent Counties. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pawtuxet River at Cranston. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Parking lots and roads are flooded in low lying areas of Warwick and Cranston near the Pawtuxet River. Impacted roads include River Street, Pioneer Avenue, Bellows Street and Venturi Avenue in Warwick. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 9.6 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1015 AM EST.
